children.value: "Graph" means graphics, images, figures in the traditional cognitive. The "Graph" in graph theory and visuzliation has specific definition: it is make up of objects and their relationships. It might not a visual graph, but a relational data.
Graph is the carrier of G6. All the operations about events, behaviors, items are mounted on the instance of Graph.
The life cycle of an instance of Graph is:
Initialize -> Load data -> Render -> Update -> Destroy.
, we introduce the process of initialization, data loading, graph rendering. In this document, we will introduce the initialization/instantiating process in detail.

The code for interpretation of this chapter will base on the following JavaScript code embedded in HTML. By defining the data, instantiating the graph, loading the data, and rendering the graph, the code below results in the graph in the figure:
// It is an edge link node1 to node2
// Assign the id of the graph container
// The width and the height of the graph
is an object of graph configurations. Most global configurations are assigned here. As shown in
// Assign the id of the graph container
// The width and the height of the graph
There are three required configurations when instantiating a Graph:
Type: String | Object. The DOM container of the graph. It can be a string for the
of the DOM container, or an object for the DOM object.
Type: Number. THe width and the height of the graph.
There are some commonly used configurations. For complete configurations, please refer to
Type: String; Default: 'canvas', the value could be 'canvas' or 'svg'. Render the graph with Canvas or SVG.

SVG rendering in G6 supports all the functions in Canvas rendering. We all known that the performance of SVG is not good as canvas. So use Canvas rendering in the case of large data instead. Expect for default nodes and edges and graphics shapes used in custom node and edge as Canvas version, SVG also supports
shape when customing node or edge. Detials are in
Type: Boolean; Default: 'false'. Whether to fit the canvas to the view port automatically.
Type: Number | Array; Default: 0. It is the padding between canvas and the border of view port. Takes effect only when
Type: Boolean; Default: 'false'. Whether to translate the graph to align its center with the canvas.
Type: Object. The global configuration for all the nodes in the graph in default state. It includes the style properties and other properties of nodes. Refer to
Type: Object. The global configuration for all the edges in the graph in default state. It includes the style properties and other properties of edges. Refer to
Type: Object. The style properties of nodes in different states expect for default state. Refer to
Type: Object. The style properties of edges in different states expect for default state. Refer to
Type: Object. If there is no position information in data, Random Layout will take effect by default. The layout options and their configurations can be found in
Type: Array. It is the set of interactions modes. One mode is made up of one or more interaction events. Refer to
Type: Boolean; Default: 'false'. Whether to activate the global animation. If it is
, the positions of nodes will be changed animatively when the layout is changed.
Type: Object. The configurations for global animation, includes easing functions, duration, and so on. Refer to
Type: Array. The plugins to assist the anaysis. Refer to
There are two required functions in the code of
For complete functions for Graph, refer to
